comments.text: A guy and a girl on a Thursday at noon without a sign. It was a good spot : there is little place to stop, but traffic is good and slow. It might be a bit dangerous, but not so much and two cars stopped to help us in 10min. We got a ride with the second car to the petrol station in the direction of Brussels.
Also possible to get to Luxembourg direction, you just have to wait longer.
perfect ! and more than perfect if you have a sign :)
On y trouve des lifts m√™me √† trois heures du mat' le week end  :)
Best place ever. I've never wait more than 10min during the rush hours !

Held sign saying Antwerp/E17. Lots of space to pull over but not a lot of spots where cars are looking your way. 

My driver was heading to Brussels but decided to take me to Antwerp in the end.
Nice spot
The first guy I asked took me and it was around 10 pm.
Really good place for transfers
Wednesday evening, the third person we asked took us to Antwerp, our ride to this station wasn't even gone yet.
large service station. 5min at the exit with a sign to br√ºgge
Perfect spot for Brugge directions. We got lift in 5 mins. We also tried to ask people directly, but that wasn't successful, but with a sign in less that 5 min success came :)
Good station if you can get this far out of town, as every one will be headed to Brugge, Oostende or Calais direction. We got a quick lift to sevice station by Veurne very quickly.
I waited 10 minutes (Fr 11:30pm). Most cars go to Oostende, few to Calais.
busy gas station direction Brugge/Oostend

Very good spot, there is space to stop and the cars are going a reasonable speed. I did get stopped by the police while i was walking to the spot. In the end they did tell me it is okay to hitchhike there, so no problems.
got a lift to lille super easy
Dirrect lift to ANTWERPEN after 1min. Belgium is so nice again.
used a sign with Gent written on and got a ride in the first car that went by

good spot for E40 in both directions
lots of space and cars are slow after the roundabout
Good Place, took me 10 minutes to get a ride in direction to Hasselt.
Only waited 5 minutes before getting a lift in a lorry to Eindhoven. Good visibility and space for vehicles.
Got a lift to Dusseldorf after 45 minutes waiting.
More cars seem to take the E34 to Turnhout and Eindhoven than the E313. Also very few cars that pass by Li√®ge. Most German cars take the E313 and 314 to Aachen.
A quite busy gas station. Many trucks.
We hardly had to wait, a car to Rotterdam dropped us of in Ghent
You can hitchhike in the evening aswell. Big lights. Moderate traffic.
Good hitchiking spot to go to Gent, cars can park easily on the side of the road.
Good spot to go to Brussels. Got a ride in 5min
petrol station, direction Brussels

Great busy petrol station with lots of cars going south and in our case to Brussels. Was dropped of here from another ride. I only approached I think 3 people before finding someone taking me and my friend all the way to Brussels
Good for going south! I was hiking with my girlfriend going to Charleroi. Lots of people stopping here because it is the only pertrol station between Antwerp and Brussels on this Highway.

Petrol station Waarloos. 
Found this a very good spot for going south. Got dropped of, spotted a car with a french license plate and asked him if he was going to Paris. In the end he was going to Nantes. Less than 2 minutes waiting time for a 750km ride!
Fastest spot in Belgium I've been at
Stood there on the highway entree, got a ride within 10sec, towards Gent. Maybe helped that we where there during work-traffic hours (6/7pm)
Got a lift to a gas station outside of Mons in no time. Good place to go ask people.
A lot of traffic to the west. I was very lucky, waited 5 minutes
Used this spot two times this week, worked well each time. Stand in the light if it's dark !
Best spot to hitchhike South from Leuven. There's a bus from the centre till there. Always found a ride quickly from there. There's space for cars to stop.
To Antwerp.
Dropped off and instantly picked up and to Gent.
Lots of traffic to Luxembourg
Not a lot of traffic going south to Luxembourg but we got lucky and hitched a ride in less than 10 minutes

Hitched a ride with Dutch people going to Maastricht, they dropped us of close to Li√®ge.
Service station with a shop, KFC and burger king.

Easy spot on the car parking near highway in direction of Germany close to the airport. 

There were no trains or buses to Cologne, the earliest would be in 4 hours, but I am impatient af. Saw it on Google map, came here, approached a truck with German plate numbers and got a direct ride to Cologne. Ez
In 5 minutes I got a rode to Meaux (30min from paris!)
Third car to pass by picked me up. Wanted to take me to Ghent, but I declined.
Asked around for someone going to Utrecht, found a couple who brought me past Antwerp & dropped my of at a good spot!
A lot of space for cars to pull over. Cars either go north to liege or south to luxembourg
Dekt very small when some other ride brought me there. But I got lucky and I immidiatly got a ride to the exact place I needed to be!

Good spot, we just stood by the side of the road outside of the gas station. There was a traffic jam, so it was easier. Plenty of space for small cars to stop. We got ride in 5 minutes directly to Gent.

IN LUXEMBOURG? HEADING NORTH? Take their free transportation to get to this spot, it will always be faster than waiting at a gas station or somewhere between Luxembourg. Peace be with you groovy groovers.
I arrived near Brugge in one lift from here, a lot of place to park, a sign may be needed
2 cars in one minutes
Fantastic place to stop by for friendly people
good, safe, visible spot by the bus stop, cars aren't very fast there. deinitely use a sign if you'd like to go past antwerpen, otherwise thumb should be just fine :)
Service station, lots of car. We were 2 people going south and got a ride to luxembourg

Good spot with plenty of traffic where you can easily catch a ride as far as the Netherlands or France. This is a point where traffic can go any direction tho, so a sign is definitely recommended.
I got offered a ride to Paris in minutes (thumb) and one to the Netherlands not much later (sign).
Best spot to go to Gent ! A lot of car pass by the roundabout, easy for them to stop over
One of the best places i've come across on my trip in Belgium. The guy who stopped was so kind that he took me directly to hennuyeres. I left him a chocolate bar for the trouble of taking a detour.

After Landing and buying some water at the minimarket i waited 5 minutes total for the right ride! In just five minutes 2 cars stopped but the first one was returning to Charleroi and i wanted to go to Bruxelles. Once in Bruxelles there are plenty of tram buses and metro (7,5 euro per day or about 2 euro per ticket).
Lots of traffic going in the right direction. Good space for cars to stop. Medium speed. Good spot in my opinion.
Lots of traffic. Only a little space on the grass for cars to stop, but its okay.
Were hitchhiking and our driver stopped us here. We decided to try a bit and got a ride within 4 mins that is going towards the netherlands

Used this spot on 2 or 3 occasions to get to the train station in Edingen. Waiting time always under 10min. In any case it's a better option than to wait for the De Lijn buses that (supposedly) pass by every two hours.
Got to Arlon fairly quickly by Romanian workers.
Good spot to hitchhike to Brugge. There is a bus stop where cars can stop and there is enough traffic.
I didnt have enough time to write my sign and i got a ride. I think its the best spot to hitchhike to Gent. Lots of space for the cars to stop, enough traffic. Perfect!
Lots of Luxemburgers get their gas here
I swear we were gonna write a new sign and we just got picked up!!!
Lots of people stop and ask where you want to go, I could even be choosey and wait until I found a lift directly to Brussels.

Not even 30 seconds, guy dropped me off Brussels airport - amazing spot 10/10
No sign
10:20am
6‚Äù1 solo white male
Lots of space to stop, feasible as well for gent
Was offered a ride a few times in a short time, even declined a few as we were hitchhiking all the way to Brussel
Cars going to all directions leaving gent.

Nice place to hitchhack ! But you need a sign! (Like in all Belgium)
I searched a ride to Brugge, i went near Courtrais "i go on the way to Brugge", take care if you don't know Flandre, with all the flamish city namew witch look alike, because its the second time i go in the wrong direction in Belgium, looks like people here don't have the sense of direction. Fortunately i'm just travelling randomly
Very easy to get a ride to Brussels from here.
1min to Antwerp
Cars can stop there easily
Great spot, we got ride to Rotterdam in 2 minutes

Lots of people stopped but unfortunately they were going in a range of directions, eventually got picked up by a van who took me to an electric charging point further up. I‚Äôm sure it is a great spot but I also look rather intimidating so I‚Äôm not surprised it took some time
Lots of cars going north, easy to stop. I had a sign with "North" on it and someone took me exactly where I wanted haha.
Great spot! Best to leave Antwerp! Lots of cars and place to stop. There is an entire lane closed for driving and cars can stop there. Sign required!
They added a lane on the on-ramp. It was easier to hitch there in the past when there was one one lane. I'd prefer the ramp near Crowne Plaza Hotel to go in direction of Li√®ge, Eindhoven or Breda.
Was about to give up because the sun was setting but then I got a ride to Li√®ge
Very good spot to join brussels, Charleroi or liege
Is just perfect to go to Brussels and Liege ! Cars have good space for stopping.
very good for brussels
Fantastic for Brussels, Liege. Very very high visibility. Cars have to stop next to you.
A pretty good spot, especially considering that it isn't a petrol or public transport station. (1 M, 1 F)
15 minute wait for E19 to Breda, very easy spot.
The 10th car stopped and brought me directly to Beringen. I used a sign 'E313 Beringen'.

Especially good during the week. I HH from here often on friday afternoon. Heading to the east: sometimes cars bring you immediately to the E313/E34, but if they aren't going the correct motorway, they can drop you off at the roundabout in Wommelgem. This doesn't work when the car is heading to the north (E19).

I've waited about 1 hour on Sunday , wanted to go in direction of Hasselt. It was better without sign as a guy who gave me a ride dropped me on Antwerpen ring but better place to hitch-hike to Hasselt.
Maybe my Li√®ge sign was a bit optimistic because nearly everyone was going to Bruxelles. Eventually got a ride to Namur.
First car I asked gave me a ride to the petrol station in Rotselaar (E314)
Lots and lots of traffic going to Bruxelles, some traffic going to Li√©ge.
Highway fuel station labeled "Thieu" in my map, however the real name is something different.
pretty good spot, lovely man named bob took me to tourcoing from here
I stood directly at the highway entrance, worked ok too even though it was dark :)

We wanted to go to Calais and this plase wasn't that good. So a guy stopped us and told us about petrol station at Jabber (about 2 km from here), that's gonna be better. It was. So not a perfect place for Calais etc..

This is most of the time my startingpoint if I go for long distances. You can go anywhere here (starting with direction 'Gent', 'Torhout' or some place near the sea). People see you from a distance and have some space to pull over.

Walked here from Leuven, asked around, two of them were going to Brussels and the third one happened to be a couple living near London, so I got a ride from here through Eurotunnel all the way to north of London. And they ended up being worried that I will get stuck hitchhiking out of the London bubble, so they bought be a crazy expensive train ticket to Manchester, so I got to my friend‚Äôs place by the evening! ‚ò∫Ô∏è

Used this hitchhiking frequently lately. Going to Wallonia/France/South is very hard if you are not willing to go via Liege. Going to Bruxelles would be a question of a few minutes and going direction Aarschot/Antwerpen/The Netherlands will take around half an hour I guess
You can walk to this place from Egenhoven! :)
good spot, many cars which go directly to Germany (at least in the time of holidays!)
Motorway services, last one before Brussels Urban area (Shell) is a good spot to either ask for a ride that goes directly into Brussels or maybe even further
I stood on the curve in front of the STIB building, waited 10 minutes with a sign on a Tuesday morning
We (two guys) stood at the bus stop for about an hour or so on a Monday morning 11ish, then got taken to Namur. Pretty OK place but traffic is quite fast.
Best place of my life !
Used this spot almost every day for a year, its the best place in brussel for leaving brussel direction namur/Luxemburg, i prefer to stand with a sign after the bus stop in the street jules Cockx
Got a ride at 0:30, best place to get of the Brussels any time of the day. You can get here on a tram, if you're on a low budget, you can consider not buying a ticket.

We were 4, we spleated in 2 teams and founded 1 guy going strait to oostend , but then the 2 left waited 30minutes again. 
Most of the people were workers or going to alost and few to gent/gand. 
Better be good in several languages !!

Hitchhikers paradise, dutch speaking part of Belgium is amazing for hitchhiking and specially this petrol station. First car stoppedand got a direct ride to Ostende, if you are going towards Ghent-Ostende, no doubt this is place. You can come by public transport
Also found a lift to the ferry in Calais from this services

You can reach this petrol station by taking bus 820 until Zellik Brandweer, than walk few kilometers towards West. I just put out my CALAIS sign and a guy stopped next to me and took me directly to Calais. Have a good luck!
Pas mal de passage, on s'est fait prendre rapidement jusqu'√† Nazareth ! Top
Instantly got a ride from an amazing woman who brought me to my home!!!
Not a lot of people going to K√∂ln, but you can get to Aachen pretty quickly and go from there. There is space to stop but not that many cars going through.
There is some space to stop but many traffics but there not so many people who goes to Germany
Fine place towards Liege
this is a nice spot to get a ride to the next gasstation befor liege. one of the more busy onramps. waited 20 minutes with a sign Liegs, standing just after the roundabout
Ride to Paris, dropped us just past Lille.

Personally i did not hitchhack there because the spots along this road didn't make me satisfied and....
There is a tramway along the coast, from France to Nederland, it does 70km, cost 2‚Ç¨50 but... You know üòâ
Nice place near a busstop. Got a ride to Niewpoort.

Would recommend to go a bit more north. The people can See you there longer an May have a better possibility to stop.

I was alone
Tough spot to get a lift. Best bet is to walk a bit down the road West(?) of NATO HQ. Also saw a bunch of Ukranian staff officers here. Go figure!
Decent place, we were 2 people, waited at the last traffic light before the tunnel, got a lift to Antwerpen in 30 min.
Very good, found a lift so easily. Fortunately when i hitched here there was some works instead of the bus stop so there is so space for the car to stop (10.2011)
Excellent place to hitch. There was no guard in his booth when I was there, around 5:30pm.  Bring a sign.
It was not so busy in the afternoon but just enough people to get a nice ride all the way to Metz

Great spot, got a ride very quick, by a couple going to Martelange (Luxembourg) to buy cheaper alcohol. However, it was then much harder to progress south. My tip would be try to wait here longer and get a perfect ride where you want to go. I was standing at the exit with a sign.
good place to Luxembourg station Berchem
Been here 2x, and always works so well here. Within 10min we found a Portuguese trucker going to Barcelona. Probably got a bit lucky ;)
If you are patient you will get a ride directly to the next petrol station in Luxembourg (130 km). But this can take time, double the average wait above!
Where some car to France, but not in the direction of Paris. Big gas station, a lot of cars. God spot, just some luck needed
Got a ride to thieu gas station before Mons after asking a few people. From thieu I got a ride to Paris really easily

It was my best match in 10 years of hitchiking. 2 minutes max. a trucker took me to paris direct.
I took the train from bx to beersel station for 3‚Ç¨, and frome here walked for 25 minutes on a nice and calm path along the river. meditative morning walk.
Got all the way to Paris from here in half an hour

Around 10 minutes wait on a Wednesday morning (10:20). 

I had a big back pack with me and 3 card boards. One with a "next gas station symbol", and the other 2 with Mons and Paris. 
The driver told me he picked me because I had the next station symbol. 
He dropped me near Nivelles from where I continued to France.
Lots of traffic indeed, very easy to find someone going in the same direction!
Petrol station "Waarloos" on the E19 direction Antwerp / NL. Lots of traffic here, maybe even too much! Standing with a sign might work better than asking.
The spot isn't ideal to take someone with you, but it doesn't take that long.
Very good spot HH to Gent. There is loads of space to pull over and people have to slow down or even stop for the traffic lights

Its a really good spot to get to the Netherlands because this road leads to the cities in that direction. I needed to reach Maastricht and it was the first driver who took me directly there. Its faster to get a ride standing with a sign.
Simply take bus number 27 from the center and leave at the last stop.

Very good spot going to East. Simply use tram 7 to station Diamant and them follow the highway till you get to shopping centre Cora (about 15 mins walking). On the roundabout follow signs Liege (Luik). There is wide road where drivers can stop.
Short wait. Stood with a sign for Lille and got a car to just over the french boarder.

Convenient place in all respects.
–úore locals.
I tried here twice. Once to Ghent and once to Lille - both are not problem.

Sign. Cars go slowly. 2 easy spots to stop (bus stop and a pull in part).

Lots of friendly people passed by and chatted.
Sign

Found a ride to Gent in less than one minute during rush hour. I had a sign "Gent". This place is really a good one since it is so close to the centre, direct access. A lot of people who work 9-5 and go to Gent or Oostende take this road.

One of the first spots where you'll see directions to get out of Brussels and to go towards other cities. We were two persons (1m1f) and waited 15minutes with a sign for Gent. Had a direct ride. Get out of Brussels before or after rush hour. HH in rush hour doubles your time.This particular spot is not so good in terms of decision time for the driver. short eye contact, small parking, fast traffic. still we found a convenient ride.
Ask people at the paying machines in front of parking P3. A sign might be useful here. Get cardboard at the supermarket opposite of parking P2.
Good dir to Bruges or ostend but we had to be persuasive
Lots of People going to Gent, took a bit until I found someone taking me further

Service station Wetteren

Brugge / Oostende / Calais

Feb 23. There's a fence around the gas station if you're walking from Kortrijk.(!!) It's really tall and probably very difficult to climb. I wasn't prepared and nearly cried. It was possible to walk under the motorway bridge and into the station via a little forest/collection of trees, however. I was there in the evening and it was dark. It's even a little path.
I arrived from a first lift coming from Lille on a wednesday morning. Found a lift directly to the center of Gent in 2 min.
Direction Gent.
easy ride direction Paris, asking people.

Great spot as a lot of cars are going to Paris/France from there. It's a big station so there are lots of chances to get a ride. I've been waiting right next to the building (there is a side walk along the wall) and I stood there for 5 minutes until I got a ride (straight) to Paris!
Lots of car in direction of Paris or Lille.
We got pity picked up ...a lot of traffic but a lot of families so a bit difficult to get picked!!
At beginning cars were ignoring me but after around 35 minutes guy stopped and took me to service station before Paris
The first car I asked was a lovely Parisian family who took me to the suburbs of Paris from here.
Got a ride to Orleans at the second car I asked
To Zaragoza after 17 minutes... ;-)
As everyone says, great spot for Antwerp withous any hassle.
Amazing for Antwerp, dutch speaking part of Belgium is hitchhiking paradise, be careful in French speaking part, dangerous
Good place even for Bruxelles.
Solid spot :)
Same as Teark.
Got a ride to Dinant very fast. You can go out if the gasstation there is a very wide area before th√© highway.
Stood with a sign for LUX->DE and got a lift to Wanlin service station close Rochefort in 15 minutes.
Got a ride to a small and really quiet highway exit in the south of Bastogne.
Nice gas station. Got a ride to the next gas station near Namur in about 20 minutes.
Picked up by a garage truck heading towards Breda, not amazing traffic but only 15 minute wait
Not so many cars passing here, but I got a ride within 5 minutes.

Onramp with a lot of space for cars to stop.
I was dropped here on my way to A'dam. There wasn't a lot of traffic on the ramp, but I got a ride in ¬±20 mins
Good place, 5min with a sign "MONS, PARIS". Got a ride to mons. BEWARE: be drop at the nivelles petrol station if someone goes to mons, not in month area as you'll get stuck, bunch of locals.

Even though we were three guys, the second car passing us directly stopped (after about 15 seconds of hitching) :) It may have been a lucky hit, but in my opinion this spot is a lot better than the one at Stalle, there's a lot more place for cars to stop, it's easily accessible and there's traffic from three directions. From now on I'll stick to this one! :)

It's a good place to go to Mons (or in the direction of Paris) and Charleroi. The best is in the winter because there's trees in front of your spot and in the spring and the summer, it's not easy to the drivers to see you. After leave this place, you can ask if the driver can drop you on the gas station of Ruisbroek, it's a big gas station close to Brussels.

C'est un bon endroit pour aller vers Mons (ou en direction de Paris) et Charleroi. Le mieux est pendant l'hiver car des arbres sont en fac

This spot can be excellent if the traffic is very slow (I tested in around 6.30pm) and you're heading south.
Got a lift to Charleroi airport area in five minutes.

Take the metro line #5 in direction Erasme/Erasmus and get off at the Ceria/Coovi stop.
Got a ride quite quickly, but not all the way to luxembourg

We were nervous to hitch from the entrance to the motorway, so tried the bus stop for thirty minutes (didn‚Äôt work!)- then moved to this spot on the bridge- within 1 minute of holding our sign, we got a lift to Sprimont petrol station down the E25
I wanted to reach Switzerland. I use a sign "LUX" on the bridge. It's the best place to stop for cars.
We stood behind the roundabout and quickly caught a ride to the first gas station near Sprimont.
Arlon, Luxembourg.
Arrived and immediately found a ride to Valenciennes, France.
i directly got a car to Assevillers gas station (before A1 dir. Paris and A29 dir. Amiens meet). Good spot !
direct to lille on a saturday after 1 min waiting ; )
1st person i asked took me to paris
Fuel Station "Spy" in direction of Charleroi and France.
Pas √©norm√©ment de passage mais on s'est fait emmen√© rapidement jusqu'√† Lille
When I walked to the first car I saw, a French plate, I got a ride to my destination, Paris.

Got I ride to Paris.
It's a large parking lot where many cars facing south stop.
Good place
Got a ride to Dijon (France) from here
Many people going to Kortrijk
I've tried to get ride all the way down to France but it failed so instead I took ride to another service station down the road
not a lot of cars but good spot, u need to arrive it by the forest, more safe
10 minutes for a ride to Dour

20 to 30 minutes wait on a Wednesday morning (around 11am). 

I had a big back pack with me and 3 card boards. One with a "next gas station symbol", and the other 2 with Mons and Paris.
Lots of french cars stop here.
Got a ride to lux monday early morning. Dont hesitate to move arround to find the best spot, just before the traffic light is good.
Lots of Luxemburg number plates, yet no one stopped
Got a ride to Wavre in 5 minutes
Slow car. Lot of place to stop and entrance of the highwa. Perfect spot to go to Ottignies or Namur
Good spot for short distances, for instance Wavre or LLN
People just start accelerating at this spot, so my guess is that they won‚Äôt easily reverse or brake
Get a bus or walk to Angleur station, the entrance ramp is very nearby. Plenty of space to pull over, got a lift straight to Luxembourg without a problem.
Quickly got a ride to Luxemburg from here with a LUX sign. There is a spot for cars to pull over safely.
Great spot. It's far and took me a lot of walking from the centre, but it was worth it. Got a bit more south to a bigger gas station.

The entrance to the highway but there is place for cars to stop. We got a ride to Luxembourg without a problem. 
If you are scared to be on a highway there is a bus stop just between the roundabouts.
Accepted a ride straight to Beauvais train station as it was getting dark
Wanted to go to calais for england. Found a couple relatively shortly that took us to a stop just before calais. Lots of traffic heading south to paris etc
Was asking around to get towards Paris. There were mainly Belgium plates, only few French and Dutch. Eventually took a ride to the next gas station south of Gent
Cool girl took us to Kortrijk shout-out to her
Busy gas station with lots of traffic from the UK. Found someone to take me on the ferry and straight to London from here. This was in mid August around 4 pm.
Still really good spot towards Liege Sunday 10 am.
Waited less than 5 minutes to go to Liege. I was standing at the Total petrol station and dropped me next to Liege on his way to Germany.

Perfect spot for going east in the week-end! A little less croweded, so a little bit easier for cars to stop. 

I got a ride to Leuven after 1 minute on a Saturday morning. 

You can push the button to cross the street on the pedestrian lane, to create a red light situation for the cars that are going in the tunnel. It might help :)

I tried that spot for like 3 minutes on a Sunday afternoon. I was standing just next to the Total petrolstation. The first car to stop was going next to Leuven. 30 seconds later, another stopped and took me till Li√®ge, on the last petrolstation before Germany.
A slghtly dangerous place, crowded, there's extremely little space for cars to safely stop and they are going quite fast...On the other hand there are many of them going to the East. Your call...

Huge parking lot with lots of traffic. Somehow still took quite a while to find someone to take me further to the coast. I was there in the height of summer, so lots of vacation traffic with their cars full.

Ranst is a huge gas station, if you're patient there's a good chance of getting a ride really far. However, I am not patient, but I've made it where I wanted to each time I've been here. Sign is probably useful.

Possible to take a bus from Antwerpen and walk from the nearby village (Ranst) to get here. No fence that needs to be climbed egen.
Direction Antwerp, got a direct ride in 15mins. June 2019
Got a great lift while writing my sign. Direction Ghent.

Was here on a Sunday. Maybe I was unlucky, or I looked too tired after 3 days of hitching, but it took 2 hours to get a lift. I used a sign for Brugge, then a sign for Gent, before just using my thumb.

This is a great spot. Everyone going on the highway and lots of place to see you and stop. Also feels safe because you can stand on a platform separated from the road. Saw some comments about police stopping hitchhikers, but several police passed me and just smiled and waved. Try this place to get out of Liege if you can. If going to paris ‚ÄùE42‚Äù on a sign is great, so you can get to a gas station on the highway.

Hot sun
Police stopped and told us it's illegal here
Good place for people to stop, though. But in the 40min, no one did.
Got a ride to Bruxelles, but it is a very steep spot. Nevertheless, there is lots of space to stop.
For Paris recommend sign "E42".
Perfect spot. Got a ride to Leuven in seconds. Cars can easily see you and has plenty of space to stop.
Solid spot, got a ride on the E40 easy

After having tried the other point near the botanical garden unsuccessfully, we picked this spot.
Enough space to stop easily.
Around 5pm, there is shade.
We made a big Brussels sign and got a ride to leuven quickly.

We (one guy, one girl) got a ride after 30 minutes to the first parking spot on the A3 motorway, towards Leuven. (Our destination was Lille). A fairly average city spot, but good because it's walking distance from Li√®ge centre.
The spot is not bad. There is a lot space for the cars to stop and they are slow but there isnt so much traffic going to Lille.
If it rains you can stand under a bridge and you are still in a good spot for hitchhiking. Traffic is all right. Enough space for pulling over as well.
Great place to hitchhike to all directions. I hitchhiked with my friend, had sign with Kortrijk and got ride very fast.

Good for direction Oostende, Dunkerque, Calais.
Put Oostende on a sign, so you can get a ride at least to the next service area in Jabbeke.
An okay spot for getting to Den Haag. (1 M, 1 F)
Got offered a ride to Amsterdam by a circus group heading to the same festival i was going!

OK place to get a ride to anywhere in Holland. Many people going to Rotterdam, Utrecht, Amsterdam. We were at the exit for a while and didn't work all that well, but then asked around and got taken straight to where we had to be in Utrecht.
Gas station. Lot's of dutch people stoping here. Got a ride to a'dam from here in no time.

A nice lady picked us up on her way home. She dropped us of at baraque de Fraiture, the highest point in Belgium.
McDonald's on the roundabout

"Borrowed" some paper from McDonalds to make a sign to Paris and found a ride after adding some in-between stops (Mons, Charleroi) by standing at the zebra path near the roundabout. Lots of cars (mostly locals, but the quantity helps) going slowly to get into the busy roundabout. My ride didn't take me too far but every bit helps, right? 
The McDonalds also has free toilets which is always a plus.

I got dropped off there on my way to Paris and had to wait only 10 minutes before I got another ride. A lot of cars passing by on their way South (or North) as it's right along the highway and there are access roads to both directions.

Sidewalk/hard shoulder where all the cars on the roundabout can see you. It's right along the highway and there's an access road towards Paris/Lille and to Maastricht/Aachen. And if you're hungry even a McDonalds.

I held a sign for Gent and got a ride in 20 minutes. It works, but It's not the best place for cars to stop because there is no bus lane. I think a lot of people were reluctant to stop because of this.
To Ghent. Somewhere on this street (plus-minus 100 meters) we stopped the car very fast. Were holding a board with text.

We stayed here for an hour, it is difficult to get to the road from the carpooling park, and cars would go very fast and there was not much room to stop, so unless it was a red light they had no chance to slow down- a couple of people offered a lift to a nearby village, but we didn‚Äôt get offered any good lifts to Li√®ge (where we wanted to go). Wouldn‚Äôt recommend for long distance !

Nice spot for hitching in the direction of Li√®ge. Much room to pull over.
Catched a ride in less than 5 min
You can find cars here going to pretty much anywhere in Germany
There is traffic going to Genk, the Netherlands or Germany. Also some UK plates.
Only had to go to the next gas station on a Sunday morning
To Genk : Good spot
Very high traffic island. Stood on top of it and was very visable.
I waited on the side of the Freeway in the direction of Waterloo. It Is a nice place for hitchikers because there's a redlight just before and there's some room on the side to stop safely
Used this spot for hitchhiking to Mons. Not much space for cars to stop, but when there is much traffic, often they are waiting anyway.
Found a car in the direction of Mons, France pretty fast by asking around. A lovely person too that gave me control of the aux.
lots of people going to the next exit and will take you

A guy and a girl on a Thursday at noon without a sign. I would say this spot is good even though people globally ignored us completely. A nice Polish guy helped us to get to Brussel while we were moving to test the best thumb spots.
Good spot to get on the highway
Good spot for heading north onto the Ring and in the direction of Antwerp. Slow traffic, good visibility, and opportunity to stop at the gas station.
I held a sign saying Merksplas, some car immediately pulled over and took me to Merksplas
Got picked up immediately all the way to Aalst, great experience haha
there's not much space for a car to stop, but lots of cars pass by
Pretty good spot, as you¬¥re at a crossroad going to both Houffalize and Bastogne (N30)

Lots of space to pull over, but traffic seemed local. I was trying to get onto the E34 to the Netherlands via Antwerp(ambitious, I know) and was offered a ride that took me further down the N9.

You might be better off taking the E40 to Ghent/Antwerp if you wanna go to the Netherlands, but I didn't try that other option. Disregarding that though, it's decent.
Had to wait for like 20 cars before someone picked me up.
A lot of drivers stop but most of them only offered short rides, fortunately trucker offered me ride to service station outside of bruxelles
Got a ride to Kortrijk, with a sign E17, the highway to Lille
Great spot, many many cars there, going in both direction (Belgium or the Netherlands). Asked the cars and people were very open to me (even tho it was 11 pm)

It works to go to Oostende, but there is not a lot of traffic... I was put a bit After the roudabout N9/N307, and the spot was great. 
No need for a sign
Picked up by a nice dude who took me to Rotterdam. Didn't have to wait too long.
Small rest area but lot of trucks.
Good spot, but lack of cars on Sunday morning. I have managed to get to a big gas station before Luxembourg city.
Spot is okay but no place for car to park. Took 20 minutes to get picked up to be dropped at a gas station a few km south.

Stalle/Boissec : 
J'ai quand m√™me du marcher depuis Stalle, la sortie d'Uccle, jusque √† ce feu rouge ou s'arr√™tent les gens qui prennent l'autoroute sud, mais j'ai √©t√© pris presque imm√©diatement par un couple de Camerounais infiniment aimables. 

Stalle/Drogenboos: 
Still had to walk from Stalle - exit from Uccle - to that red light where all the cars that take the southern highway stop at. Was picked up almost immediately by a camerunese couple, infinitely nice.
the first time i hitchhiked there, i got a lift in five minutes to Concarneau ! Perfect :) but it surely does not happen every day :)

bad spotbecause car don't have time to stop if they want to take you (red light time is too short) and not very confortable under the bridge (noises..).
But if you walk 15 meters away, at the entrance of the ring, it is a very good spot, cars can stop and see you in advance :)
good spot, even if red light is not the best, but enough time for people to consider taking you
While heading to Ireland, a family heading home from Poland took me with them for a night in their van and even offered me a night in their guest room.
Was heading to the UK. I was stupid and got in the first car that stopped that took me to the next gas station. BAD IDEA. There is lots of traffick heading to callais here, so do not go further.

I waited here for 1 hour trying to find a ride to the UK. I eventually decided to take a ride one gas station further. A BIG MISTAKE!
Though there are not many cars going to UK here, at least there are some. At the next gas station there was one car in the first hour, that is it.
So, even if it seems bad, don't get tempted to go one gas station further. You'll regret it.

I've caught a ride from here to the UK in late December 2023 and again in early March 2024. It works! Although it can take a bit of time to find somebody who is up for braving the ferry and border situation with you... As of March 2024 THERE IS NO DRINKING WATER (unless you want to buy it at petrol station prices) and the staff are really unfriendly.
We put a Hitchwiki sticker in this place! (on a traffic sign by the exit) We got offered a ride going straight to Newport, Wales, our destination! Camped there. (September 2014)

Quite good spot just before the tunnel leading to E40 towards Li√®ge. Right side of the road was full of parked cars which made pulling over a bit more challenging. There's a traffic light just before and good visibility so drivers can see you from a far and can consider longer if light is red. Had a sign saying 'Li√®ge' and got a ride from a business man heading back home on a Friday afternoon.
Nice place to catch a ride to Antwerp or Leuven :)
There is a traffic light I used twice. You may stay in front of the high way entrance (see the other place close by) as well. I thought it might work better with the traffic lights ‚Ä¶
Less traffic during the weekend. You might have more luck at Belliardstraat than. It's not far
I've hitchhiked here about 40 times I guess. Waiting times between 0 and 20 minutes. Your succes will depend on the moment : lots of people going home after work pass here between 15:00 and 18:00
Lot of people stops but it is mostly local to go to Tournai. There are place to stop and traffic ok for a tuesday morning. On the way to Mons
to Bruxelles, Monday morning
perfect for lille
road to Brussels
A good place for Lille, Mouscron, Bruxelles, Mons, Namur.
Not much traffic on the service station
After 45 minutes, I got a lift to Aachen. Some german cars, but also lots of traffic towards Hasselt and beyond
It was easy to find a ride to Genk
We came got here very late (8pm) and I think that was the problem. We needed to go to Liege but most of the cars were going to Brussels of Leuven. We weren't lucky this time. Avoid HH in dark!
Got a quick ride to Germany (Aachen/Cologne) form here.
A very bad spot for getting to Antwerpen. After a long wait, finally, one guy took us. The problem is that there is a lot of traffic, wouldn't recommend bus stations in general. (1 M, 1 F)
Good spot to Antwerp, lots of traffic and space to stop.
Lmao, good spot. caught a ride to Antwerpen in 30 seconds
Got a ride to Antwerp after about 20 minutes, very good spot.
Took a lift to Breda (NL) after about 20 minutes

More people going to the Netherlands than Li√®ge but I still found a ride there in under 30 minutes. Even got approached back! Bonus points for the cute dog I got to have on my lap (not reflected in the rating.)
Good spot to go to Lille or Paris.
We waited one hour to get a ride to Holland. Most cars are going towards Liege, Luxembourg or Germany, but nearly non towards Brussels, Antwerp or the Netherlands.
Good spot if you want to continue to Germany or Belgium. Free Showers for Truckers.
Quite a slow day, due to an EU summit. Nevertheless, had a good time waiting and got a good lift with 2 Belgian gentlemen.
idk why this is marked as a good spot, visibility is good but hard for cars to stop w/o blocking traffic. I stood on the sidewalk before the entrance to the parking
Waited 30 minutes with 2 persons to get to li√®ge, lot of car passage
Take the Tramway to Diamant and then wait for a lift to Li√®ge
Enough Dutch folks here
It was difficult to find cars going directly to Amsterdam from this petrol station but finally we found it after 1 hour of hitchhiking
With sign "Gent". Got a ride to halfway (Sint Niklaas).
Since cars can go to all directions from here, it's advisable to use a sign. Lots of traffic so waiting times are usually quite short.

The spot is placed before an entrance to the tunnel and after the last crossroad with a traffic lights. A car can stop in a branch of road just in front of the tunnel entrance.
Direction Gent, Brussel.
Not great, not terrible. After some waiting, found a nice guy willing to take us to Brussels. (1 M, 1 F)
Quite some traffic towards Brussels too!

Petrol station Aire de Noidre Est. 

Great for Maastricht (ask any Dutch driver). What about Brussels and Antwerp?
Had NL on our sign, got a ride pretty quickly
Hard shoulder is not very wide, careful when walking to this access lane, busy road. Great for Antwerp / Brussels.

Direction Antwerpen, Brussels, (Gent).
Stand before the blue "start of motorway" sign, the car can stop on the hard shoulder.
Not really a good spot, no place to stop, a lot of cars going fast
Picked up by a very nice young couple who took me as far as Brecht. They went out of their way to help me.
Wasn't really hitchhiking. It was night and I was sitting with my backpack on the station, when a car stopped and asked if I want to go to Breda and I agreed
Station is abandonned now

To Paris. N266, Rue des Deux Gares/Tweestationsstraat. There's a gas station a few minutes' walk away from Gare du Midi. No need for public transportation to get there and plenty of space for cars to stop. The traffic depends on the time and day of the week, but always reasonable, and most are heading for the Ring. 
We waited for 20 minutes before getting a straight ride to Paris.
Quickest ride in my life haha, I got dropped of from a car and another car stopped, told me that I looked like a hitchhiker and offered me a ride to liege.
South to Liege or north to Maastricht, a place to hitchhike if you can't make it in one ride.
Not so busy and was a bit difficult to find somebody who travelled to Lille.
Regular service area.
Arrived after sunset, the second guy I asked drove me straight to Aachen
Got ride here quite fast, going southern direction, not all the way to my destination (Luxembourg) but still nice hitch. Sunday 11 am.
Was heading in direction of K√∂ln. Only got a ride to Eupen, but i think i fine spit nonetheless.
Quite easy to go to Brussel from here, I needed to head to the west and needed to ask 7 people, so it was quite ok

We were extremely lucky to catch a ride all the way to Nijmegen from here on a Sunday. Sundays appear to be good for rides to the Netherlands from here because many Dutch people ("dagjesmensen") return from short trips to the Ardennes then.
Currently (feb 2023) both roads are inaccessible due to construction works. I took the tram to luchtbal P&R and got a ride with the first car I saw.
10 minutes without a sign and the driver stopped but I waited more 15 minutes and next car was going to Breda.
10 min. to BREDA with Romanians.
less than a minute to the petrol station in the direction of Rotterdam! good pot. had a sign m/f
Sparse traffic, but easy for drivers to stop.
A lot of cars coming through. There is a spot where all the cars have to pass through so i suggest standing there. Got a lift to Liege quick.
First person I asked took me to the gasstation in Waarloos, maybe I was lucky
I found a ride to Antwerp (Dutch driver) and a ride to Leuven in just 15 minutes.
I agree with the first comment, especially if you travel longer distances.

We tried to get through Brussels in the direction of Luxemburg. It took us 4 h until we decided to go into the city and with public transportation to the other side. A lot of traffic into the city and to Antwerpen
We rejected a ride 15 minutes in to the next gas station before Gent because this one is so big. This was a mistake, next one was much easier to get a long distance ride though
Got an immediate ride to Lille.
Lots of people also going to Sint-Niklaas.
Lots of people also going to Sint-Niklaas.
Gas station

18:00 to 19:00 on a Friday, very practical spot. If planning to travel up east to Germany, hold a sign for Eupen. A sign meant for any further and the cars won't stop. From Eupen, it will be much easier to hitchhike onwards.

This spot is best for direction west (Belgium)
When i go to hitchhike there, i always have a sign, because there are different possible destinations ... good spot for Brussels
I used this place to go to namur a few time, its working but it's not the best hitchhiking spot ever !
Highway entrance, direction Namur or Brussel

Immediately found a ride to Neuss, Germany even though it was fairly late already and there weren't a whole lot of cars around. Just look out for German license plates. My ride even fed me and offered to buy me a coffee!
Good number of cars and big gas station
There was not too much traffic coming around. Still okay though.

Small restaurant and parking on the E42. Not too busy, but there was still a fair number of cars coming through. Quite easy to get a ride onwards towards Liege and Aachen, bit harder to find someone going to Maastricht/NL

Stand a bit further, where the on and oframp split. There's a side rod there where drivers can pull in. Had a few offers for direction Brussels but I waited for a ride towards Lille and got it after 38 minutes.
Good for getting to Kortrijk. Probably Brussels, Bruges and Ostend will also be easy here.
one boy midday of cold Wednesday. Very easy to reach via the nr 1 metro from the center (take till end station P+R Luchtbal). Cars go pretty ast but enough space to stop.
There is space for cars to stop, but the traffic movies quickly.
I came here to hitchhike but its a terrible spot. The cars are fast and there isnt any space for them to stop. I decided to walk to the other side of the river.

Hitched June 2019, there's construction so the space to let the car pull by is less. I got a ride towards the tunnel end in 10 mins, aiming to a direct redirect so I stay, got another offer to after tunnel end in 5mins.
15 mins to Ghent! Nice spot with bus lane, plenty of room to stop!
Picked up somebody who was hitchhiking there. He stood there for 5 minutes or something.

At the entry of the tunnel there is a bus lane.
It is'nt often used so you can wait here for a lift.
Cars driving slow, so very great spot!
Nobody would talk to me at the pumps or exit.
Took some time to found someone going to Paris. Don't afraid to ask people on petrol station.

Steady trickle of cars late at night on a Saturday. Lots are local or going to Luxemburg. For getting to Liege you have to really ask them where they are going to find someone driving past Liege to let you out in the subburbs. Traffic to Paris, for example, is good.

Indeed few cars but on Saturday at 18:00 there appeared few cars every 5 minutes, but they were usually fully packed. Nevertheless my girlfriend and I got a lift in Brussels direction. If you are going to Leuven, they can drop you out in a petrol station next to the city.
there were only trucks (1 or 2 per minute) on a sunny day, 12:00, 28/02/2013 (thursday) and no truck stopped for me. I went to the other place, 10 min walking
place with restaurant, mini supermarket, parking place mostly for trucks, bridge to cross the autobahn

On the road just outside the gas station is also a good spot. The highway onramp seems to be useless.

On a saturday night, the only people stopping for me were going back to Aachen. Eventually I took a ride back to the border, used the pedestrian bridge to change sides, and hitch hiked to Liege.
This place can be good on friday afternoon or week end, ask to be drop in a gas station on the road. Gas station are not big but help to do a lot of distance
This HH spot is senseless if you go anywhere else than Aachen. 99% of the cars comes here just to buy a cheap petrol and go back home.
gets you to Antwerp, but not a safe spot
Direction Antwerp: Not much space to pull over, but traffic is really slow.

I waited here for 2 hours trying to find a ride to the UK. There was very little traffic on a Monday night and I was just happy to accept a ride to Calais in the end, shortly before sunset. The driver drove me there out of pitty, I think.
But seriously, stick to the bigger service station in Jabbeke. There's not a ton of traffic either, but at least you spot a UK licence plate every now and then.
Only little traffic on a thursday afternoon. Still okay spot.
Casually hitchhiking while waiting for the bus. Seconds before it arrives, somebody picked me up.
Beaucoup de passage, les gens roulent vite mais ont de la place pour se garer. Plusieurs personnes se sont arr√™t√©es mais n'allaient pas dans notre direction
Manque de place pour se garer, peu de gens qui s'arr√™tent ou qui n'allaient pas dans notre direction (Gand). Une dame nous a finalement d√©pos√© √† l'air 3km plus loin !
Not a bad spot, cars go to gas station.
Cars enter the highway very fast, there is some space to stop tho, best is to hold a cardboard with the direction you want to go because lots of cars go to Gent, Brussel, Aalst, Oostende...

There weren't a lot of cars but I got a lift offer every 20 minutes further down the road to the entry of the N49. 

I was aiming for the E34/Antwerp and none of them headed down the E34. I was told the entry of the N49 doesn't have a lot of good spots to stand in but have no evidence of that.
 Might be a victim of my rigidity, or maybe I made the right call not getting stranded at the entry of the N49. We will never know.

Also signal here is bad so download GMaps beforehand.

We tried to signal with the thumb at the exit, then asked around, then returned back and signaled for longer. Alot of people are going only to town right next to it. It was really hot outside today so it was hard, but eventualy great guy took us beyond Mons.
Waited for 60 minutes to Hasselt, but nobody picked us up, so we put Liege on the sign and got a ride almost instantly. There is a semi ok spot to stop at the end of the merging lane.
Wanted to go to paris, but the best we got was Brussels
Onramp spot with a bit of space for cars to stop. Pretty good traffic, but semi-local. Found a ride to Namur after 20 minutes with a sign to Mons/Charleroi/Paris.

Brussels > Lille
A guy took me to tournai
Not very busy but ok. Plenty of trucks but not so many cars.
Ok place with a Sign for Brussel
With Brussel sign, we got a ride to Boom in 20min. BTW, not the best spot to stop the cars there

This spot should work, but didn't work for me. I was trying to get to Luxembourg. But it was Sunday morning, so maybe it was just the lack of cars. But I found out that on weekdays lot of people commute to Luxembourg, so you might have more luck. I had to however move more north for a better spot.
Pas le meilleur spot, aucune place pour se garer. Personne ne s'est arr√™t√© donc nous avons chang√© d'endroit

I think not a good spot , was about 1500-1600, mostly old people in a cars, or people with kids, or poor(idk) so not much cars stop by, I was going to Brugge, and further there‚Äôs high way with a lot of directions, so I thinks this is also a reason

Usually a good spot if you want to go to Valenciennes (everyone seemed to be going there) and further down to Paris. I wanted to go to Lille though and it took me a full 3 hours to find someone. I did find a right directly to my destination though, they even did a detour for me, so that was super sweet. It was pretty late at that point (I waited from 7 to 10 pm so I imagine that it was getting late might have toggled a little pity)
Took a bit of time but got the perfect ride to Paris
We were trying to get to Germany and we found a lift to take us to the E40. Lots of taxi drivers though so not much help
Most traffic is passing by this gas station, lots of taxi's. Luckely got a ride after 1,5 hour waiting to Ghent.
